articles.title: Scientists create a two-dimensional carbon material eight times stronger than graphene - Earth.com
articles.summary: Scientists create a two-dimensional carbon material eight times stronger than graphene A new carbon material is gaining attention for its incredible resilience, offering hope for stronger and more durable technologies. Rice University scientists report that monolayer amorphous carbon (MAC) is eight times tougher than graphene. This two-dimensional, single-atom-thick material combines crystalline and disordered regions, creating a unique composite structure. The...
